Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the photo was taken in Pakistan, when in reality it was taken in India.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove that the photo is from Peshawar, Pakistan, as it is actually from Allahabad, India.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim presents an alternative explanation by suggesting that the photo is from Peshawar, Pakistan, but it is actually from Allahabad, India.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the condition of the road by stating that it is the result of a round of light rain, when in reality it was a severe level of damage caused by heavy rain in India.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the photo is from Peshawar, Pakistan, based on the misleading Facebook post, without verifying its authenticity.
Understate: The claim understates the popularity of the Gemini Circus by mentioning its falling popularity in a September 2019 report, without providing further context or evidence.
